intro: Sorbus turkestanica f. dulcis, commonly known as the sweet rowan, is a botanical variant of the Turkestan rowan. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Central Asia, characterized by its ornamental value and unique fruiting habits. The plant features compound leaves and produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red or yellow in color. Its flowers are white and appear in clusters, contributing to its aesthetic appeal in gardens. This form is notable for its edible fruits, which are sweet and used in local cuisines.
